title: Specified Entity
description: In part 1. only, defines which affiliates are considered when assessing Termination Events or Events of Default. NB: it excludes specified entity mentioned in the clause Absence of litigation

title: Specified Transaction
description: Defines what types of transactions qualify for cross-default or other provisions.

title: Cross Default
description: Election of whether cross default applies and threshold amounts.

title: Specified Indebtness
description: This defines the type of indebtedness that counts for purposes of the Cross-Default provision

title: Threshold amount
description: This is the minimum aggregate amount of Specified Indebtedness defaults that must occur before a Cross-Default is triggered

title: Credit Event Upon Merger
description: This is an optional Termination Event where if a party (or sometimes its Specified Entities) merges, consolidates, or transfers substantially all its assets and the resulting entity is not as creditworthy, the counterparty may terminat

title: Automatic Early Termination
description: Election whether AET applies in the event of insolvency.

title: Payments on Early Termination
description: Section under the 1992 ISDA

title: Termination Currency
description: Specifies the default currency for close-out calculations.

title: Force Majeure
description: Election and modifications to the Force Majeure provision in the 2002 Agreement.

title: Additional Termination Events
description: Custom termination events agreed by the parties (e.g. credit rating downgrade, regulatory changes).

title: Credit Rating Downgrade
description: Termination event  triggered if a party or its credit support provider is downgraded below a specified rating by a rating agency, often linked to collateral posting or termination.

title: Credit Support Provider Event
description: Termination event  occurs if a guarantor, parent, or other credit support provider fails to maintain creditworthiness or withdraws its support.

title: Hedging Disruption
description: Termination event if a party is unable to hedge its exposure due to changes in market conditions or liquidity constraints.

title: Increased Costs of Hedging
description: Termination event  triggered when regulatory or legal changes make the transaction more expensive or unlawful to perform.

title: Tax Event / Tax Event Upon Merger (Expanded)
description: Termination event when tax law changes that increase a party's tax burden, or adverse tax consequences arising from a merger or reorganization.

title: Ownership / Change of Control
description: Termination event  triggered if a party undergoes a merger, acquisition, privatization, or change in controlling ownership.

title: Failure to comply with documents
description: Termination event if failure to comply with pecific  documents

title: Regulatory Event / Dodd-Frank / EMIR Event
description: Termination event occurs if compliance with derivatives regulations (e.g., clearing, margin, registration) prevents or burdens performance.

title: NAV per share decline (for Funds)
description: Termination event if a fund's Net Asset Value per share declines below a specified threshold or by a certain percentage.

title: AUM/Asset Floor
description: Termination event if total Net Asset Value or Assets under management fall below an agreed level.

title: Investor Redemptions
description: Termination event if redemptions exceed a set percentage (e.g., 25, 30% of NAV in a quarter).

title: Key Person Event
description: Termination event if a named portfolio manager (or team) departs, termination can be triggered.

title: Change of investment manager
description: Termination event if there is a change of investment manager

title: Breach of Investment Guidelines
description: Termination event if Material breach of agreed trading restrictions (e.g., leverage caps, concentration limits).

title: Fund Termination / Liquidation
description: Termination event if the fund itself winds up or enters liquidation.

title: Portfolio/Asset Trigger
description: Termination event linked to performance or impairment of a specified pool of assets, often in structured finance swaps.

title: Loss of Hedge Provider Status
description: Termination event  if a party ceases to qualify as a registered swap dealer, bank, or other regulated trading entity.

title: Governmental Intervention / Bail-in
description: Termination event  triggered by regulatory intervention such as resolution authority action under EU BRRD or similar regimes.

title: Delivery Failure
description: Termination event  if a party fails to deliver under a physically-settled derivative, common in commodity or equity swaps.

title: Specified Transaction Termination Event
description: Termination event If a related financing, loan, or hedge transaction outside the ISDA is terminated, causing linked exposure.

title: Sanctions Event
description: Termination event occurs if a party becomes subject to international sanctions, making performance illegal or impractical.

title: Non-Posting of Collateral
description: Termination event If a party fails to post collateral as agreed (sometimes treated as a Termination Event instead of Event of Default).

title: Other Termination events
description: Termination event not listed above

title: Failure to pay or deliver
description: Failure to pay or deliver

title: Tax representations
description: Part 2. Tax representations

title: Payer Representations
description: Party representations about eligibility for tax exemptions.

title: Payee Representations
description: Party representations about eligibility for tax exemptions.

title: Delivery of Tax Forms
description: Obligations to deliver forms such as IRS W-8, W-9, etc.

title: Tax Provisions
description: Elections on tax gross-up obligations and exemptions.

title: Documents
description: Part 3. Documents

title: Corporate Documents
description: Charter documents, certificates of incumbency, and authorizations.

title: Financial Statements
description: Agreement to provide audited or unaudited financials periodically.

title: Legal Opinions
description: Opinions from counsel regarding enforceability or capacity.

title: Guarantees
description: Delivery of parent guarantees or other credit support documents.

title: Other Documents
description: Any bespoke documents the parties agree to provide.

title: Address for Notices
description: Specifies mailing/email addresses and contacts for official notices.

title: Process Agent
description: If required, designates a process agent for service of process.

title: Offices
description: Usually in part 4., provisions of Section 10(a)

title: Multibranch Party
description: Specifies if a party may transact through multiple branches.

title: Calculation Agent
description: Designation of which party (or third party) will act as Calculation Agent.

title: Credit Support Document
description: In Part 4, this refers to any collateral or guarantee agreement provided to secure the obligations under the ISDA Master Agreement

title: Credit Support Provider
description: This is any third party (often an affiliate, parent company, or guarantor) that provides credit support (via the Credit Support Document)

title: Governing Law
description: Choice of governing law (usually New York or English law).

title: Jurisdiction
description: Selection of courts with jurisdiction and whether jurisdiction is exclusive or non-exclusive.

title: Waiver of Right to Trial
description: Each party waives its right to a jury trial in any litigation relating to the ISDA.

title: Arbitration
description: Sometimes, instead of courts, the parties agree to resolve disputes by arbitration (e.g., under ICC or LCIA rules).

title: Affiliate
description: Affiliate is already defined in Section 14 of the Master Agreement (control / controlled by / under common control).

title: Absence of Litigation
description: This is an additional representation confirming that there is no pending or threatened litigation that would materially impair a partyï¿½s ability to perform its ISDA obligations.

title: No Agency
description: Confirms that the relationship is principal-to-principal, not agent-to-agent.

title: Additional Representation
description: This is a catch-all for any bespoke representation the parties want to include beyond the standard ISDA reps (e.g., eligibility, regulatory status, compliance).

title: Additional Events of Default
description: Bespoke default provisions (e.g. failure to deliver collateral).

title: Amendments
description: Bespoke clause related to the management of amendments

title: Netting of Payments
description: This confirms (or customizes) the ISDAs netting provisions.

title: Set-off
description: Optional clause giving set-off rights upon default or termination.

title: Recording of Conversations
description: Election to allow recording of telephone conversations.

title: Confidentiality
description: Custom confidentiality obligations.

title: ERISA
description: A representation relating to the U.S. Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA).

title: Severability
description: Standard contract clause: if one provision is invalid or unenforceable, the rest remain effective.

title: Escrow Payments
description: Provides that if there is a dispute over a payment obligation, the disputed amount may be placed in escrow pending resolution.

title: Limitation of Liability
description: Caps or excludes certain liabilities.

title: 2002 Master Agreement Protocol.
description: The ISDA 2002 Protocol introduced standard amendments (close-out methodology, set-off, etc.).

title: HIRE Act Protocols
description: Refers to the ISDA Protocol implementing the U.S. Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment (HIRE) Act of 2010, which imposed withholding tax rules.

title: Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act
description: Specific provisopn related to FATCA (withholding is carved out from tax gross-up obligations)

title: Dodd-Frank
description: Clause related to DODD FRANK regulation

title: U.S. QFC
description: Clause related to US QF Stay regulation

title: Transfer Restrictions
description: Restrictions on assigning rights and obligations.

title: Foreign Exchange and Foreign Exchange Option Transactions
description: Foreign Exchange and Foreign Exchange Option Transactions

title: Commodity transactions
description: Commodity transactions (full section related to FX transactions)

title: Forms
description: Forms in appendix
